sentence.text: Bartter syndrome type IV, characterized by salt-losing nephropathies and sensorineural deafness, is caused by mutations of ion transmembrane transport or simultaneous mutations of both excretion and excretion.
gap junction assembly is the primary causative gene for non-syndromic sensorineural deafness and associated with several syndromic sensorineural deafness.

Our results indicated that the homozygous mutation c.22C AAAA T was the key genetic reason for the proband, and a digenic effect of ion transmembrane transport and GJB2 might contributed to sensorineural deafness.
